me.wobblyyyy.pathfinder2.robot

Interface Odometry

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Modifiable<PointXYZ>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractOdometry, EmptyOdometry, MeccanumDriveOdometry, SimulatedOdometry, SwerveChassisOdometry, ThreeWheelOdometry, TrackableWrapper

    public interface Odometry
extends Modifiable<PointXYZ>
    A system capable of reporting the position of a robot. Several odometry systems available for use are provided with Pathfinder. If you'd like to create your own implementation of the Odometry interface, it's suggested you make use of the AbstractOdometry class instead - it abstracts away many of the tedious methods.

    It's strongly suggested that you don't perform any offsetting on the odometry's reported positioning outside of the methods provided in this class. This helps to ensure that positions are only modified from a single source, making debugging a lot easier.

    Some of the most common forms of odometry include...

    • Vision-based odometry
    • Three-wheel odometry
    • Two-wheel odometry
    Optimally, you should use as many odometry systems as you can to maintain the best positional accuracy. However, that's not really very realistic, is it? An odometry system's only job is to provide information on the position of the robot it belongs to.

    Since:
    0.0.0
    Author:
    Colin Robertson
    See Also:
    AbstractOdometry

      • Methods inherited from interface me.wobblyyyy.pathfinder2.robot.modifiers.Modifiable

        getModifier, setModifier

    • Method Detail

      • getRawPosition

        PointXYZ getRawPosition()
        Get the raw position reported by the odometry system.

        I'd also like to suggest that you make use of the method PointXYZ.zeroIfNull(PointXYZ). Doing so will ensure your odometry never reports a null position. I personally have had some issues with exactly that, so I'm putting this warning here so I can possibly save someone a bit of a headache.

        Returns:
        the raw position reported by the odometry system.

      • getPosition

        PointXYZ getPosition()
        Get the position produced by getRawPosition() combined with the offset produced by getOffset().
        Returns:
        the odometry system's position, with an offset.

      • getOffset

        PointXYZ getOffset()
        Get the odometry system's offset.
        Returns:
        the odometry system's offset.

      • setOffset

        void setOffset(PointXYZ offset)
        Set the odometry system's offset.
        Parameters:
        offset - the new offset. This offset value will replace whatever the old offset value was.

      • getOffsetX

      • offsetBy

        void offsetBy(PointXYZ offset)
        Modify the existing offset by whatever offset you provide.
        Parameters:
        offset - the offset to add to the existing offset.

      • removeOffset

        void removeOffset()
        Remove the current offset. This will set the offset to (0, 0, 0).

      • offsetSoPositionIs

        void offsetSoPositionIs(PointXYZ targetPosition)
        Create an offset that makes the odometry's current position the provided target position.
        Parameters:
        targetPosition - the position you'd like the odometry system to be offset to.

      • zeroOdometry

        void zeroOdometry()
        Find an offset that makes the odometry's current position equal to (0, 0) and apply it.
